question: who was executed for being an american spy during the revolutionary war
api_result: During the American Revolutionary War, Nathan Hale is perhaps the most famous individual who was executed for being an American spy. Nathan Hale was a soldier for the Continental Army and volunteered to spy on British troops. He was captured by the British and executed on September 22, 1776. His purported last words, "I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country," have made him a celebrated hero in American history.
